results.title: The India trip
results.creator_credit: Bill Davies, George Pearson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Pondicherry, an ancient city near the Southern tip of India, was for several centuries an outpost of France. Now the French influence has faded but another, stranger, colony is growing on its outskirts - Auroville, a community of Europeans and North Americans who have come to live the contemplative life. They are devotees of Sri Aurobindo, a Bengali poet and mystic, and their guru is a ninety-four-year-old woman from France. This spiritual mecca is described in the film by Albert Jordan, a professor from Concordia University, Montreal, who, in 1971, with his family, spent a year there.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Davies, George Pearson and National Film Board of Canada

This spiritual mecca is described in the film by Albert Jordan, a professor from Concordia University, Montreal, who, in 1971, with his family, spent a year there.

results.title: The Flute
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Richard Adeney, British flautist, discusses the development of the flute over ten centuries showing how the number of holes in the body of the instrument gradually increased and how the use of keys led to the complete chromatic scale. Illustrated by excerpts from Schubert, Mozart, Bizet, Tchaikovsky and Gluck.

results.title: In touch with the world
results.creator_credit: James B. Maas and David H. Gluck Productions and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human senses”.
Explains the functions of the human skin as a sense organ and the ability of the receptors to differentiate between at least five different kinds of sensations - touch, pressure, heat, cold and pain. Shows how the sense of touch has contributed to human development and adaptation of the human species to its environment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James B. Maas and David H. Gluck Productions and National Geographic Society

results.title: The Image makers
results.creator_credit: Albert Kish, Adam Symansky, Peter Katadotis and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A documentary about the National Film Board of Canada made to commemorate the Board’s 40th anniversary in 1979. It is a montage representing the work of over 400 people whose dedicated efforts have garnered over 1800 international awards for the Board. Sometimes majestic, sometimes whimsical, the film is a revue of a nation’s sights and sounds.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Albert Kish, Adam Symansky, Peter Katadotis and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Clarinet. Pt. 2
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, EFVA and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Jack Brymer of the BBC Symphony Orchestra talks about the history of the clarinet. He demonstrates all the instruments which form the clarinet family, from the high E flat to the contra bass, showing how they work and how to play them. Director Muir Mathieson was music director/composer for Sir Alexander Korda’s London films in the 1930s and 1940s.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, EFVA and World Mirror-Realist Films

results.title: Matter of taste
results.creator_credit: David H. Gluck, James B. Maas, Naomi Robin, James B. Maas and David H. Gluck Productions and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human senses”.
Looks at the important role played by taste in the human body. Investigates the chemical reactions in papillae and how information is obtained and relayed to the brain and the taste identified as sweet, sour,salty or bitter.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David H. Gluck, James B. Maas, Naomi Robin, James B. Maas and David H. Gluck Productions and National Geographic Society
results.description:
Episode of Series “The Human senses”.
Looks at the important role played by taste in the human body. Investigates the chemical reactions in papillae and how information is obtained and relayed to the brain and the taste identified as sweet, sour,salty or bitter.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “The Human senses”.
Looks at the important role played by taste in the human body. Investigates the chemical reactions in papillae and how information is obtained and relayed to the brain and the taste identified as sweet, sour,salty or bitter.
